posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If I recall correctly, the highest possible damage in a single blow would be from a Paladin built to maximize his Smite Evil, but that is only once per day. The highest average damage per round would be from a strength-based Weapon Master with a scythe, unless the target is immune to critical hits, in which case the greatsword and greataxe are pretty much equivalent to each other.

posts.author: Valkos
posts.content: The thing about a smiter tho, is that the smite itself gives extra AB that is not restricted by the +20 cap to AB. Meaning if you have a ton of charisma, you get that to your AB. 38 + 20 + let's say 26 charisma and +12 from items(14)= 82 on 3 smite evil attacks. This is by no means shabby and will hit just as well as a WM with 28 levels.

posts.author: Mirnaia
posts.content:
The answer will very much depend on the game environment, what kind of enemies there are and what kind of gear is available. Here's a few.
It's already been mentioned that the highest damage single strike is a smite, and the most HP removed at once is an area instant death spell or turn undead, or a lucky series of great cleave devcrits.
The highest Devastating Critical DC is 53, this build makes it an effective 55 if you can cap Str.
The highest instant death save is versus a DC 48 Implosion. 50 (38+12) WIS, ESF: Evo, Implosion has an innate +3 DC.
With mundane items only, what's the highest damage per round against a crittable 0 AC target dummy? I'm not sure, but a max Str 10 APR Ranger/Cleric 15+/Monk with Bane of Enemies, and FE: target dummies :) won't do too bad (beats fists because of the fire DF (the magical DF applies to fists too.))
The highest DPR achievable against a single target requires a 10 APR enemy if you have damage shields and can get hit reliably.
For a trapper who knows how to stack them (or -oh, the horror- pauses the game), all bets are off.

In a not too high magic environment, there isn't much that this guy can't handle (especially if you replace the TW feats with say, BF, KD and craft wand.) It doesn't *suck* on high magic but other builds catch up.
